page.title: 03THE LINKS CLUB-LOWESTOFT
page.content: The Links Club,which provides a link between all clubs for the hadicapped in the waveney district,was founded in 1975.The building is pre-war and was once the club house for a golf club on Gunton Cliff.Members of the club are aged from 16 years upwards.Clubs pay 5 pounds a day or 3 pounds an evening to use the hall.A grant of 4800 pounds is given by the council.In the grounds are five bungalows which are designed for handicapped people.They have wide doors and slopes,and plugs at a suitable height for wheelchairs.Volunteers transport people who want to use the club. Activities include handicrafts,AA counselling groups,mental after-care and chest,heart and stroke clinics.The public are able to visit the clubs and take part in their activities.
